tip: The term given to the money that we receive.
A tax on earnings. Income tax is only payable on earnings above an individual’s personal allowance.
The amount that must be paid by law to an individual for the work they do. The rate of pay depends on the employee’s age.
A deduction from earnings, based on the level of weekly income. The contributions made build up entitlements to certain state benefits.
Pay As You Earn is the method by which employers take away deductions, such as income tax and national insurance, before you are paid.
The amount of money you are able to earn before paying any income tax.
A form of long term investment to be used in retirement.
A way of getting paid for a job. It is usually a set amount each month paid directly into your bank account.
